popt4jlib.neural.costfunction

Interface FFNNCostFunctionIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    FunctionIntf, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CategoricalAccuracy, L1Norm, L2Norm, L2NormReg, MAE, MSSE

    public interface FFNNCostFunctionIntf
extends FunctionIntf
    all FFNN cost functions must implement this interface so that their gradient can be "auto"-computed.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double evalDerivative(double x)
      evaluates the derivative of the cost function as a function of error (a single variable).
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] d_per_instance)
      computes the partial derivative of this function on an array of values that is the derivative of this function on a set of training instances and labels.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] input_signals, double true_lbl)
      same as evalPartialDerivativeB(weights, index, input_signals, true_lbl, p) but uses the grad-vector caches instead of the last deriv cache.
      double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights, int index, double[] input_signals, double true_lbl, java.util.HashMap p)
      evaluates the partial derivative of the entire network's cost function (as a function of its weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index.
      FFNN4TrainB getFFNN()
      get the ffnn to which this cost function is a member of.
      void setFFNN(FFNN4TrainB ffnn)
      sets the ffnn in which this cost function is a member of.

      • Methods inherited from interface popt4jlib.FunctionIntf

        eval

    • Method Detail

      • evalDerivative

        double evalDerivative(double x)
        evaluates the derivative of the cost function as a function of error (a single variable).
        Parameters:
        x - double
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                              int index,
                              double[] input_signals,
                              double true_lbl,
                              java.util.HashMap p)
        evaluates the partial derivative of the entire network's cost function (as a function of its weights) with respect to the weight variable whose weight is given by the value of the weights array in the given index.
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        input_signals - double[] the input signals for the network (an instance of the training data)
        true_lbl - double the true label corresponding to the input_signals vector
        p - HashMap includes the train-data matrix and train-labels array.
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] weights,
                              int index,
                              double[] input_signals,
                              double true_lbl)
        same as evalPartialDerivativeB(weights, index, input_signals, true_lbl, p) but uses the grad-vector caches instead of the last deriv cache.
        Parameters:
        weights - double[] all variables (including biases) array
        index - int the index of the partial derivative to take
        input_signals - double[] the input signals for the network (an instance of the training data)
        true_lbl - double the true label corresponding to the input_signals vector
        Returns:
        double

      • evalPartialDerivativeB

        double evalPartialDerivativeB(double[] d_per_instance)
        computes the partial derivative of this function on an array of values that is the derivative of this function on a set of training instances and labels.
        Parameters:
        d_per_instance - double[] must have been computed from calls to evalPartialDerivativeB(wgts,ind,train_inst,train_lbl,p).
        Returns:
        double

      • getFFNN

        FFNN4TrainB getFFNN()
        get the ffnn to which this cost function is a member of.
        Returns:
        FFNN4TrainB

      • setFFNN

        void setFFNN(FFNN4TrainB ffnn)
        sets the ffnn in which this cost function is a member of.
        Parameters:
        ffnn - FFNN4TrainB
